subdisciplines.name: Constitutional Theory
subdisciplines.description: The subfield of political theory that analyzes and interprets constitutions and examines how they are used in practice.

subdisciplines.name: Democratic Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of how democratic institutions and processes should be designed to promote democratic ideals such as freedom, equality, and fairness.

subdisciplines.name: Feminist Political Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of the intersection between gender and politics, and how political concepts, theories, and practices impact women's lives.

subdisciplines.name: International Political Theory
subdisciplines.description: The subfield of political theory that focuses on issues of global concern, such as international relations, globalization, and human rights.

subdisciplines.name: Political Economy
subdisciplines.description: The study of the relationship between politics and economics, and how economic systems impact political institutions and outcomes.
